alert.note: Alert for La Paz; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 13 at 7:10PM MST until August 13 at 9:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL YUMA AND CENTRAL LA PAZ COUNTIES... At 710 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain of up to 2.5 inches across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Quartzsite, Brenda, Kofa Wildlife Refuge, Vicksburg Junction, Vicksburg, Bouse and Palm Canyon. This includes the following highways... AZ Route 72 between mile markers 23 and 32. US Highway 60 between mile markers 31 and 40. AZ Route 95 between mile markers 115 and 123. AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 22 and 31. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
